job_title: Human Resources Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: Agency cares for their employees
cons: always something going on within the agency

pros: Kind people and managers that care, benefits are good, and work life balance
cons: Pay is not nearly enough

review_title: ACRC great for experience, not for pay
pros: A lot of experience, amazing co-workers, benefits are great, PTO and Bereavement leave, etc.
cons: Pay is not much, too much of workloads are out onto SC’s with little to no consideration of workloads, have to train new hires, etc. most of what we do is out of our scope of practice

pros: -working independently on tasks - building relationships with clients
cons: -pay is not high enough for job duties -does not support employees in completing hours for MSW while working there

review_title: They will fire you in a heartbeat!
pros: CalPers retire benefits that are matched by employer
cons: When I started at Alta I was told that I can't be late for a meeting because that would be grounds to get fired. And, if a client's family complains about you (don't people love to complain even if you are providing excellent care coordination?) an empoyee can get fired for that as well. I've seen 2 really great employees fired in the last 6 months! That being said, if you are not a perfectionist, do not apply or work with this non-profit. It isn't worth the stress. The documentation is very heavy, not to mention that I have 87 clients!

review_title: Overall a good place to be but low pay.
pros: Great union. Hybrid work schedule. Help those in need.Great benefits and amazing insurance.
cons: The agency is fighting moving in to the 21st century. Your job quality really depends on your manager. The pay does not keep up with the industry standard.

review_title: I'm already looking for another job!
pros: This employer has a Union, but employees cannot utilize their services until employed for 12 months. There is an on-site gym.
cons: You will have to manage 94-100 clients! It is expected that care coordinators will write a case note for every phone call, every email, every text, every conversation with a supervisor or peer in order to receive 400 points per month in documentation and billing time! It's extremely stressful and not worth the pay!

pros: great entry level role for social workers
cons: overworked and horrible company structure.

pros: Hybrid work schedule. Helping people with disabilities.
cons: Focused on metrics and not clients.

pros: ACRC is a nice place to work overall.
cons: Lots of turnover which has put pressure on those who stay employed with agency.

pros: Good management, loved the families I worked with.
cons: Not enough service coordinators, leading to extremely high cases, which leads to burnout.

pros: Work hours are very flexible
cons: Can be a lack of training

review_title: Great learning experience - need better management
pros: Ability to learn quasi-state union environment
cons: Very emotionally fueled work environment- at times a hostile work environment

review_title: If you like steady and easy then this is the place!
job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Sacramento, CA
pros: Work-life balance, CalPERS retirement, non demanding workload, culture
cons: Antiquated view of HR, monotonous days, culture

pros: Benefits and opportunities for growth
cons: Really low salary and not enough support from management

pros:
Excellent benefits
Hours can be flexible depending on manager
cons: Sometimes there can be a lack of communication from upper management

job_title: Client Services Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: There is flexibility in daily schedule.
cons: Limited room for advancement. No ability to work around school schedule.

pros: ACRC is a great place to work at.  My co-workers are the best.  We work together to meet our caseload's needs.  Our supervisor is very supportive and very flexible.  Our executive listens to us and visits us to give us a pat in the back.  Our executive team often sends encouraging emails to us to give us that push during a down day. We have great holidays, even on days that others are working.  Our health benefits are great, we don't have to pay a lot out of pocket.
cons: Sometimes we work long hours to resolve family issues, but the best thing is that we always come up with the best solutions.  Our compensation is ok and average but we do get increases once in a while.  Our office culture is very diverse so we have different languages whispering in the hallways.  Our cubicles are ok but it needs more private gaps because others can here you talking with your clients.

pros: This was a great job that provided flexible scheduling and telecommuting after you proved yourself for 6 -12 months. They provided a laptop for work in the community. Great staff and a union to help make sure you get the best benefits possible.
cons: I wish the pay could have been higher, but it is a social work job and fairly competitive in their wages.

review_title: The work that we do is good, the employer does not compensate it's employees well.
pros:
Benefits are good, middle managers are good and competent.
Emploees are nice and helpful.
cons:
Management does not want to pay employees well. We haven't had a COLA raise in over 10 years.
Management is actively trying to destroy our union.

review_title: Great benefits, but not really social work
pros: State sponsors benefits and pay increases each year. Caseloads were heavy, but manageable.
cons: The company is against calling themselves social workers, which makes the work very disingenuous. Poor management who is not culturally humble or responsive.

pros: Positive working environment, training, agency makes an effort to show appreciation for employees, supportive supervisors, meaningful work, good pay, benefits and time off
cons: Caseloads can be high, some employees not pulling weight

pros: Alta Regional Center was a really great job when initially entering the social work field. I feel it is great for gaining experience, and coworkers are very supportive of each other.
cons: However the pay is not great and the caseloads are very high.

pros: Great work environment with excellent health benefits, pension plan, life insurance
cons: Very hard to move up the career ladder

pros: Great company to work for.
cons: Paperwork overwhelming may cause alot of stress.

pros: Great people, inspiring clients, good benefits very supportive work environment
cons: Moderate salaries; no part time limited telecommuting

job_title: Service Coordinator in San Bernardino, CA
pros: Good people amazing clients flexible scheduled
cons: Lots of paperwork low salaries

pros: Positive resourceful friendly helpful environment
cons: I don't have any cons.
